Cloud Mobile Computing Workshop 2015

on Cloud and Mobile Computing

Helsinki, HKUST & Tsinghua

HomeProgramCommitteeVenue

Beijing, 20 - 22 August, 2015.

The 2st Helsinki-HKUST-Tsinghua workshop on cloud and mobile computing is a three-day workshop jointly organized by the University of Helsinki, Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, and Tsinghua University.

The workshop is intended to bring together professors, researchers and students to share ideas, experience and implementations related to cloud and mobile computing, including SDN, augmented reality (AR), urban computing, big data analysis, mobile offloading and 5G networks.

Airport transportation, bus taxi route to university:

  1. By the Airport Express (AE). This service is a regularly recommended approach for visitors arriving into Hong Kong. You can find a route using MTR (public subway transportation) map (attached). The nearest MTR stations to HKUST are Hang Hau (to the south of HKUST, exit B1) and Choi Hung (to the west of HKUST, exit C1). You can then take mini-buses (11,11M or 11S, all having signs showing "HKUST" as the destination) from these MTR stations. The bus ride takes about 10-15 minutes.
  2. By taxi. A taxi ride from the Hong Kong airport to HKUST goes all the way east, takes about 40 minutes, and costs around HK$350 (US$45).

University map:

UST location map, Campus map and IAS route map are attached.

Dinner places:

The lift map is attached to find the dinner place. In university, we usually have dinner in G/F Chinese Restaurant (recommended), LG1, LG5, LG7 and Cafe.

Hotels:

If you need hotel accommodations near HKUST, you can try Holiday Inn Kowloon East or Crowne Plaza Hong Kong Kowloon East. They are both above the MTR Tseung Kwan O station and you can take bus 792M directly outside the hotels to HKUST.
